alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Waldo; Interior York; Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 16 at 4:07AM EST until December 18 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...PROLONGED WINTER STORM EXPECTED THROUGH SATURDAY... .A coastal storm developing near Cape May New Jersey will move northeast today and strengthen as it crosses southern New England. This will bring the first widespread winter storm to the local area though Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT EST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Snowfall of 6 and 10 inches with the greatest amounts further inland. * WHERE...Central Interior Cumberland, Interior Waldo, Kennebec, androscoggin, and Interior York Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to Midnight EST Saturday Night. * IMPACTS...A snowstorm will bring plowable snow to the region with a period of moderate travel impacts expected. Periods of moderate snow and low visibility will be the biggest hazards. Heavy, wet snow at times may lead to downed tree limbs, resulting in power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will mix with rain at times today before transitioning to all snow tonight.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
